content: this pattern is also available on the blog for free here 1 make a gorgeous triangle shawl using tunisian crochet stitches that create a beautifully textured fabric the pattern uses alternating tunisian simple stitches and twisted knit stitches to create two mirrored panes that grow on the bias and create a light curve on the top side of the shawl this makes the shawl drape nicely on your shoulders **skill level** intermediate or enthusiastic beginner you need to know how to make tunisian simple stitches tunisian twisted knit stitches and tunisian full stitches follow the videos if you are not familiar with these stitches **finished size** if you use the recommended yarn you will get a shawl that is about 180 cm or 70″ in length and 70 cm or 27″ in depth at the widest point **notions** you can use any dk or size 3 yarn in your stash preferably wool any kind of wool not just sheep wool or acrylic or a blend you can also mix colors or use gradient cakes you will need approximately 600 meters or 300 grams or dk or size 3 yarn and an 8 mm tunisian crochet hook with a cable between 60 cm and 100 cm is what i find is usually available either will work as you can cram lots of stitches on the cable if you use much thinner yarn go down a hook size or two if you use thicker yarn go up a hook size in the end you need to be able to slip the stitches on and off the hook easily **videos for porphyry** there are two video tutorials available for the first five row and the binding off for both right-handed 2 and left-handed 3 crocheters 1 https //yarnandy com/free-tunisian-crochet-shawl-pattern-porphyry 2 https //youtu be/26bghhan9gi 3 https //youtu be/rbzvsy-afvw
